Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sluffer
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights in this hotel and we were really pleased. The room was large and comfortable with a nice balcony. There is a nice little swimming pool for the use of guests. The front desk personnel were extremely helpful and accommodating. For example one of them noticed that I was using my computer a lot in the lobby. So asked if I was having trouble with the WIFI in the room and when I said I was she spent 20 minutes working with my computer to solve the problem and all this without being asked!

Reviews.Title: “Just an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: HiramNovelo
Reviews.Content: Las month I went to riviera Maya staying 4 nights, and stayed 3 more at Playa del Carmen. Since the Riviera hotel was sooooo pricey (but totally worth it) we decided to book just an affordable hotel. This one looked nice on the pictures, and the location is great. I dint have that many complaints about it, however I would think twice if I had to stay there again. Lets say its a petite hotel, the rooms are way too small, the TV is way too small, in fact, It was kind of funny there is no real furniture at all but a chair, everything else is made out of the same room, it was kind of funny actually. They said that the remote for OUR Tv was missing, so we had to get up to change the channels everytime, since OUR TV was the only LG one, and they didnt had any other remote for that one. I liked that our room was right in front of the pool, which is on a second floor, so you get a view of the fifth avenue. The pool by the way was pretty small as well, but it was ok since there were very few people during our stay. You get a free continental breakfast with eggs and toast at this restaurant in the front of the hotel, however the service there was terrible, we only had it once since the first day we waited for 10 minutes for them to give us a seat and they didnt even stoped to say hold on a moment, they basically ignored us completely, the girl at the front desk however seemed concerned about that when we told her our poor experience at the restaurant. Overall, it was an ok, average staying, I guess I should ask for more for the price we paid, but I think there are better hotels out there for the same budget

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!!”
Reviews.Author: MellieEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the Easter break and it was awesome!! Right on 5th ave but far enough down from all the noise. The hotel was really clean and all you need in Playa. Only blocks away from public beaches where you can rent 2 chairs and a hut for 90 pesos. Or go to Walmart and buy your own umbrella to take to the beach. The beaches are breath taking and amazing, the sand never gets hot!!!! and the colour of the water is beautiful. The rooms are kept very clean and you can rent a in room safe for $3 a day. The TVs do have static but you should not be in Mexico to watch TV! The showers tend to run cooler water than warm but after a hot day it is refreshing. The coffee shop Ah Caoco is amazing, ask for Henry he will take care of you and the Aca Los Tacos is perfect for some great food and they make the best drinks!!! The perfect hotel for a wonderful stay in Playa. The front desk do have a hard time understanding English however just draw some pictures and you are good to go. Free breakfast in the morning with the best coffee. Defiantly a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Us”
Reviews.Author: BNCLOVER
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was perfect for us. It's right on the famous 5th Avenue in the City Center approx 2 blocks from one of the best beaches. Just outside the open lobby, is the most popular coffee house in town, A Cacoa. Your room coms with a continental breakfast at Karma's Bagels. This breakfast is not fancy. It's toast, juice, dry cereal, coffee or tea and yogurt. Just enough to get you going without dipping into your pockets right away. The rooms are clean but on the smaller side. If you can check in early and request a room with a balcony, they are nice. When we arrived, they were all taken, but we spent absolutely no time in our room, so it wasn't an issue for us. The hotel is completely tiled , which can be noisy, but guests figured this out and were considerate of each other. The tile kept the hotel cool and comfortable. The tv is hooked up to cable, but you need to push the cable button or you'll have a fuzzy screen. We watched little to no tv, so this wasn't an issue for us either. The staff is friendly and nice, but speak very little English, so they don't always understand what you are asking them. They will do their best to make you happy. I cannot comment on the pool - we never used it, but its cute and looks perfect for that quick dip. This hotel fit us perfectly. It was economical, clean and in a great location. It is not a resort, but one of the several "boutique" hotels on and near 5th Ave which is loaded with bars, shops and restaurants of every type and price.

Reviews.Title: “Definately coming back to this hotel next time!”
Reviews.Author: Andreassons
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 3 children, 4, 14, 17 years at the time, and this hotel was perfect for all of us! It was clean, perfect situated in the middle of the shopping street "fifth avenue" but still only 5 minutes walk to the beach. Friendly and conserned staff at the hotel. There was nothing we had to complane about, everything was terrific! And still it wasn't expensive! All of us is longing to come back to Playa del Carmen and Caribbean Paradise hotel. Andreasson family, Gothenburg, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay in a town with many good budget options”
Reviews.Author: Samantha41
Reviews.Content: Whilst it is true that this hotel has a good location and the rooms are clean, we had serious problems with the staff. We came home at 4.45 pm the second day after going to one of the ruins to find two men in our room--one at the foot of one of our beds watching tv with the air conditioning on, whilst the other had removed our glass doors leaving debris all over our bags and clothes and was sitting outside on a ladder. The reception staff had no idea that the men were in our room nor that this work was being done and the manager was disinterested with the situation leaving the desk staff to try and deal with the fact that our room was unfit to enter for another hour. At check out, we were led to believe that we got a discount for our trouble, which we did not ask for but appreciated. But after checking out one of us left our bag at the hotel and returned to collect it and the manager refused to give it to us unless we paid extra money saying that the desk staff was wrong about the price and he wanted more money. We had traveled throughout Mexico for 2 weeks and had a wonderful time and stayed in many great hotels both budget and mid range. It was very disappointing to be treated so poorly at our final destination and I would highly recommend that people looking for clean, reasonably priced accomodation go elsewhere as there are many wonderful places in Playa del Carmen but this is definitely not one of them. Candice, London, England

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CapeBreton1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April 2006. We booked this through our travel agent. This was our second time to the area, the first we stayed at an All inclusive. There was one couple traveling with us.When we arrived we checked out our rooms, they were very small, and we were staying for two weeks so we upgraded them at a cost of $200. Canadian for two weeks. We got a great room on the top floor in the corner with two bacalonys, we had a great view of 5th ave and the beach. We could see Cozumel from our balcony. The room was very clean and comfortable , air conditioning worked great, tv worked great, bathroom was clean, shelves for our clothes, and hangers. Rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels we left something for the maids daily and they always left something on our bed. The toilet was plugged one day and we let them know at the front desk on our way out and it was repaired when we returned. Breakfast was tea, coffee, toast, jam, this was ok and when we wanted more we went to a restaurant. We ate at various restaurants on 5th ave and all the meals were great. never got sick. We enjoyed being able to choose different places to eat each day. We did a lot of exploring and went on day trips. This was our second time to Playa del Carmen so we were famalier with some of the Trips available. We did our trips on our own. We took a taxi to Puarta Adventura and arranged Deep Sea fishing with Captain Ricks, also Parasailing there. There is a bus station on 5th ave so we took the bus to Cancun for the day. Went shopping and checked out the hotel zone. Another day we went to Cancun and took the ferry to Isle Medaize, island of the women.(sorry for the spelling) When there we went snorkling with a local boat, it was great. We walked to the end of 5th ave and took the ferry to Cozumel for the day. We found that it was cheaper to go on our own, and had no time limits to explore. We liked this hotel and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: jimmythedirt
Reviews.Content: First off this is a great place if you are on a budget. If you want all the razzle dazzel go elsewhere. If you are lookin for a great deal, in a great location with really friendly service this is the place. Its a humble little place but the So here goes! the location is fab. Its near the end of the maya "strip" so its quieter but only a minute walk back to it all. Its a 1 minute walk to the beach which is drop dead beautiful. There is a very affordable reastuarnt down stairs ($3-$5 meals) great for lunch and across the street Bip Bip with friendly service and great prices for dinner and drinks. There is no food included in the hotel..the breakfast is just toast but seriously there is so much around that is cheap and safe to eat ( i never got sick once) its no biggy. Theres a wonderful coffee shop downstairs that keeps a freindly casual and fun atmosphere too. The hotel service is friendly and helpful, i was short cash when i got there for the safe and they just said, oh just pay it when you can...and they never hounded me for it ( i paid it back) This isnt' a place if you are looking to have a vacation to "feel like a king" but its a great place to feel great on a budget! i'm planning go again in Dec! i'd highly recommend it, save your money on accomidations and spend it on shopping! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean Paradise is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: iamone
Reviews.Content: Hey, just wanted to let everyone know that Caribbean Paradise is a great little hotel!!! They actually double-booked but we got to stay in another hotel on 5th avena and 6th calle. It is called the Hotel Delfin. Wonderful there too!! Great time had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a casual holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 2 weeks of holiday in playa del carmen/hotel caribbean paradise. This hotel does not offer luxery, but it is a nice, clean and safe place to stay at. Our room was cleaned every day, and there are locks at the door to the balcony and at the window. The location at 5th av. is perfect, as the beach and entertainment are right in front of your door. Staff is very friendly, too. As another guest already posted: if you like to be pampered, this really is the wrong place for you, but it is a nice hotel for a casual holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Visit Hotel Caribbean Disaster "Caribbean Paradise"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've visited Caribbean Paradise recently in Playa del Carmen. Strongly I recommend not to book this hotel because what the people show in the website is not true, this hotel even doesn't reach 1 star level or something around that rating. I had a lot of trouble, the rooms are not comfortable, the bathroom small, the sliding doors from the balcony are broken by burglary (NO LOCKS!!!) at least 5 rooms were like that and I couldn't trust this place anymore. The room I was assigned to was not clean even the towels and trash from priveous guest were still in the room. The breakfast was terrible only toast and jam and no other choices if you want to enjoy other things, you can't call this CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST, the small place where you eat is full of bees because they don't clean the tables from the jam cups even during the afternoon the breakfast trash is still on everytable including the bees and flies. The kitchen is dirty. The television signal is not good, and the room have old furniture. All the services the websites show is not true about this hotel. I don't know what the owner is doing with the profit of the high rates??? But not investing in quality. Because they are very high for this crap hotel, these people should feel ashamed to charge those rates because they don't offer anything good in this place. You better think twice before booking any room in this hotel. And look for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bidulbuck
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 weeks in that hotel (25 June to 10 July) and are waiting for our next trip ! The location is excellent : on the Quinta Avenida but not in a noisy area, 3 minutes by foot from the turquoise sea (Beach Club EL TUKAN), and close to restaurants, shops, bars, drugstores, travel agencies, supermarkets ... The rooms are clean and comfortable : king size bed, AC, cable TV, nice yellow painted walls and a small but nice bathroom. The swimming pool is on the 2nd fllor, medium sized but not busy at all. The breakfast may seem to be light for American or German people, more used to eat some cornflakes yoghurt or sausages/ham, but is perfect for French or British people : toasts, coffee/tea/milk, marmelade and butter, fruit juice. See the pictures enclosed. Good place to stay if you are not a all inclusive addict and prefer to be independent. Have a good trip in MEXICO !

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Good Location - Not Luxury”
Reviews.Author: bfowles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 2 week (Sunquest) vacation at the Caribbean Paradise. This hotel is located at the 'quiet' end of 5th avenue about 1 1/2 blocks from the beach. It is a four storey walk-up design (no elevator) with cafe/bar/restaurant on the lobby level. There is a small pool on the 2nd floor which we did not use during our stay. Rooms are quite small and I would recommend an immediate upgrade from the Standard room provided by Sunquest. We were lucky enough to get (for an additional price) a balcony room facing the main street on the top floor. If you don't like stairs DO NOT stay in the upper floors of this hotel. The restaurant is quite inexpensive and we thought it was fine for a very casual lunch or dinner. My gut feeling is that a standard room here would be a bargain at around $50/USD per night. I wouldn't really consider this hotel unless you could pay around that price for a standard...slightly more for an upgrade. I plan to e-mail Sunquest and suggest they offer more than ONE hotel which is not all inclusive - for those of us who like to explore and not always eat & drink in their hotel. Just a word about 5th Ave. We live in downtown Vancouver (near Robson St) and were amazed that 5th Ave was as busy as our area, however there is a quiet section of 5th just north of this hotel. We found ourselves enjoying the quiet part of 5th ave much more. It also seems to attract the Europeans giving it a very different flavour. If you want loud crowds and lots of people trying to sell you things then stick with the busier section of 5th. 10th Ave also seemed to have a quieter feel, with a fair selections of restaurants. All in all a super little town to explore and enjoy the sunshine in (we came back to minus 9 degrees and snow....yuck). Brock Fowles Vancouver, BC

Reviews.Title: “Much too little for MUCH TOO MUCH!!”
Reviews.Author: herescu
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two weeks vacation in Playa del Carmen, Caribbean Paradise Resort & Spa. It is in Caribbe, all right! Paradise? Hard to say! Resort? Haven't seen any! About the Spa? Never used it. The rooms are pitifully small (the size of a crowded prison cell), lacking basic amenities such as a table or chairs, no bathroom door (smell and shower vapors spreading all over the bedroom!) no balconies or a very minuscule one, view of the back garbage infested site. Otherwise, friendly staff but unhelpful, nice location but noisy, same EP breakfast every day for 14 days (toast, coffee, jam and orange juice). We found much nicer accommodation within Playa del Carmen at much better price and started to wonder why Sunquest vacations picked up this modest hotel with unjustified overly priced rooms, below any normal present day tourist standard. We have seen European tourists commenting in shock of what was offered to them. We had to fight with the management for three-four days until we where upgraded (at a price!) to a more livable accommodation, still very modest with what you should get for your money. The Sunquest reps where remarkably absent in assisting us and do not expect any help from them. Overall, if you can avoid it, DO IT! Nick and Eveline, Calgary, Alberta, CANADA.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, friendly, on budget, no frills.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from PDC and enjoyed ourselves to the fullest. The hotel is, as noted, clean, safe, friendly, on budget with no frills. The hotel is immediately north of the main tourist shopping district on 5th Avenue, about 3 blocks west of the beach and in the midst of the best local restaurants. Breakfast of coffee and toast is included. One restaurant attached to the hotel serves good food at average prices but there are lots of other restaurants of every variety nearby. The stay was remarkably quiet considering the two main streets that meet right in front but we heard no street noise at night. The pool is quite small but works to cool you off and provides adequate room to tan in private. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful at setting up tours/rentals if language was a problem. If you like to be pampered this is NOT the place for you. It was great for the traveller who just needs a secure place to stay or as a base of operations. InMyHumbleOpinion - why break the bank on an expensive place to lay your head?, there are better things to spend vacation money on than your hotel room.

HotelInfo.Name: Caribbean Paradise Resort & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 5th Avenida Norte Esq. Constituyentes, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
